channel.title: Lists on David Winterbottom

item.title: Lies you're told on a software project
item.description: In approximate chronological order: “Sorry I missed stand-up this morning” “I didn’t see that email” “I’ll get back to you shortly” “Sounds easy - should only take a couple of days” “It’s nearly finished” “I didn’t have time to write tests” “We’ll clean this up later” 1 “Lessons have been learnt” Remember: "Later equals never." - Le Blanc's law — Programming Wisdom (@CodeWisdom) March 20, 2017 [return]
